faq.q1: What is a root canal treatment and why is it needed?
faq.a1: Root canal treatment is performed to save a tooth that suffered from inflammation or infection in the root canal, allowing you to keep the tooth in your mouth.
faq.a2: The procedure is typically performed under local anesthesia and should be pain-free – extra support is provided if needed.
faq.q3: How long does a root canal take?
faq.a3: A standard root canal takes between one and two hours, and sometimes requires several appointments.
faq.q4: Are there restrictions after root canal treatment?
faq.a4: In the first days after a root canal, it is recommended to avoid chewing on the treated side and to maintain strict oral hygiene.
